core.title: مهارات العلاقات لدى المدير. الجزء الأول (The relational skills of the manager. Part A)
core.description:
تطوير نظام اتصال ومعلومات ملائم.
التواصل بشكل متسق وبحسب احتياجات الفريق.
التحضير لاجتماع الفريق وترؤسه بنجاح.

learning_outcomes:
ستتمكن مع نهاية الجزء الأول من هذا البرنامج من التواصل بفاعلية مع زملائك، واختيار الأدوات المناسبة، والتكيف مع متطلبات الموقف واحتياجات الفريق.
ستتعلم التحضير للاجتماعات وترؤسها بفاعلية.

core.title: فريق العمل: الأدوار و القواعد (Team work: roles and rules)
core.description:
هل أنت على دراية بمصطلح "الراكبين مجاناً أو المنتفعون بالمجان"؟ هل تعرف كيف تتعامل مع الراكبين بالمجان في الفريق؟ يوضح هذا الدرس صعوبة العمل مع المنتفعين بالمجان في الفريق ويناقش أهمية ميثاق الفريق كأداة في مكافحة مشكلة الراكبين مجاناً أو المنتفعين بالمجان.

 

هذا الدرس سوف:

يساعدك على تحديد الراكبين مجاناً في فِرق العمل أو المنتفعين مجاناً ،و وصف مكونات ميثاق الفريق وأهميته.

 

الفئة المستهدفة

التنفيذيين، والمدراء، وكبار المدراء، والقادة

core.title: المهارات الوجدانية ( العاطفية ) للمدير (The emotional skills of the manager)
core.description:
تحليل الآليات العاطفية والانفعالية.
تحديد وإدارة انفعالاتك وعواطفك.
إدارة المواقف المشحونة عاطفياً بفاعلية.

learning_outcomes: سوف تتعلم كيف تصبح مديراً أفضل عبر إدارة انفعالاتك وعواطفك في العمل. سيمكنك هذا البرنامج من أن تكون أكثر جاهزية لتوقع المواقف الحرجة والصعبة من خلال إدراك النواحي العاطفية والانفعالية لشخصيتك، كما ستصبح أكثر قدرة على الاستفادة من الآثارالإيجابية لانفعالاتك ومشاعرك إن ألممت بالطريقة التي تعمل بها ووظفتها بطريقة صحيحة لصالحك.

core.title: الخطوات الأولى في الإدارة (First steps in management)
core.description: تم تصميم هذه الدورة التدريبية لمساعدتك على فهم مهارات الأشخاص في القيادة الفعالة. من خلال هذه الدورة، سوف تتعلم تصنيف المهام مع القدرة على ترتيب أولوياتها وتفويضها حسب الأهمية

learning_outcomes: تحديد الأهمية القصوى للمهارات الاجتماعية بالنسبة للقائد
تصنيف المهام مع القدرة على ترتيب أولوياتها وتفويضها حسب الأهمية
وضع الثقة في أعضاء الفريق واكتساب علاقات صحية سليمة

core.title: التفكير في تطوير فريق العمل (Thinking about team development)
core.description: توضح هذه الدورة التدريبية كيفية تطوير فرق العمل، وتساعد في فهم أهمية تنمية الأفراد داخل المؤسسة. سوف تستكشف من خلال هذه الدورة استراتيجيات محادثات التطوير الوظيفي المختلفة لتحقيق أقصى استفادة من فرق العمل في المؤسسة

learning_outcomes: التعرف على أهمية تطوير الموظفين داخل المؤسسة
إدراك الحاجة إلى إجراء مناقشات التطوير مع موظفيك
تحديد وتطبيق استراتيجية المناقشة التي تناسبك
فهم وتطبيق إجراءات تحليل الاحتياجات التدريبية
مساعدة موظفيك من خلال تدريبهم وتوجيههم بشكل مباشر

core.title: إدارة الخلافات في بيئة العمل (Managing conflict at workplace)
core.description: تناقش هذه الدورة التدريبية إدارة الخلافات في مكان العمل، وتساعد على فهم كيفية تحديد أنواع الصراعات أو الخلافات في العمل، وأسبابها الشائعة والسلوكيات التي تظهر بسبب التوتر في العمل. تم تصميم هذه الدورة لمساعدتك على التدرب على الحلول للحد من التوتر لدى الموظفين والتعامل مع النزاعات من خلال فهم الأسباب والحلول المحتملة

learning_outcomes: تحديد مفهوم التوتر في بيئة العمل
التعرف على الأسباب الأكثر شيوعاً للتوتر في مكان العمل
تحديد السلوكيات التي تظهر بسبب التوتر والضغوط في العمل
التدرب على الحلول للحد من التوتر لدى الموظفين
شرح طبيعة الخلافات والصراعات في بيئة العمل
كشف أي خلاف قد ينشب في مكان العمل والمبادرة بمعالجته
حل الخلافات في بيئة العمل بأفضل ما لديك من قدرات

core.title: Would I Follow Me - Leadership Best Practices
core.description:
Course Overview

A good leader requires a great deal of self awareness.  A leader must understand his or her own style of leadership and look for the adjustments that are necessary to lead more effectively.  Only with this desire for self improvement can a leader hope to improve others and inspire them to actions that yield results.

This interactive forms part of theWould I Follow Me Series?

Download the course Journal Here.

core.title: Workplace Violence
core.description: Compliant with the training aspect of CA SB 553, this course provides important protection for employees by showing how to spot classic red flag situations and how to minimize the potential for violent episodes in the workplace. Note: While this course is also appropriate for a global audience, employers must implement measures in addition to this course to be in compliance with the requirements of CA SB 553.

learning_outcomes: Meet California SB 553 training requirements to recognize, and speak up about violence and violence prevention in the workplace
Train global employees to know how to recognize red flags that suggest a person will become violent
To learn basic strategies to use if you find yourself in a threatening or violent situation
To learn basic strategies if you ever face an active shooter situation
To understand the importance of reporting concerns and incidents

core.title: Working Remotely
core.description:
It has been estimated that by 2028, 73% of teams in the workplace will have members working from home.

Whilst working remotely has many advantages, to some, it can feel like Groundhog Day with a sense of disengagement and a lack of camaraderie.

This Working Remotely eLearning course is chock full of tips on how to maximise enjoyment and productivity whilst working remotely. It also includes a fantastic section on ergonomics and avoiding distractions in the home.

learning_outcomes: How to resist burn-out and avoid the trap of ‘Groundhog Day’
Apply effective time management techniques
Create a dedicated and ergonomic work space

core.title: Working From Home | Module 2: Working From Home For Employers
core.description: Working from home or remote working is becoming common practice for many businesses. This short course will provide employers with information on their legal responsibilities for employees working from home and how to support employees to work safely productively and effectively when working from home.

metadata.summary: Best practices and legal obligations to aid employees in working from home effectively.
learning_outcomes: What it means to work from home and its advantages
Your legal responsibilities for employees working from home
Establishing clear expectations for employees working from home
How to support employees to set up productive and safe home working environments

core.title: Working From Home | Module 1: Working From Home For Employees
core.description: Regardless of whether this is a choice or a necessity due to crisis situations working from home or away from the office is increasingly the new normal. This short interactive course provides you information on your responsibilities and tips on how you can work productively safely and effectively when working from home.

metadata.summary: How to make your working from home environment safe and support your needs.
learning_outcomes: What it means to work from home and and its advantages
Establishing expectations around working from home
How to set up a productive working environment at home
Maintaining work/life balance

core.title: Working Effectively From Home - Beginner
core.description:
In this course, students will learn helpful strategies to support their adjustment to working effectively from a remote location. Tips are provided to help employees designate a suitable remote workspace. In addition, students will learn strategies to optimize productivity, streamline communication, and maintain a work-life balance. Students are encouraged to self-assess their level of engagement and productivity to experience success as a teleworker. 

 

Prerequisites

There is no prerequisite for this course. 

 

Certification

This course aligns with the CAP Body of Knowledge and
should be approved for 0.25 recertification points under the Operational Functions content area. Email info@intellezy.com with proof of completion of the course to obtain your certificate.

metadata.summary: Learn helpful strategies to support their adjustment to working effectively from a remote location.

core.title: Work Life Balance
core.description: Do you live to work or work to live? In this course you will explore your motivation and priorities, and discover how the answers to strategic questions can help you create a healthy rewarding balance between the activities in your life. Through interactive assignments and a rich multimedia process, this course will help you realign with your priorities and experience the life you desire.

learning_outcomes: Recognize the areas of your life that are creating a work/life imbalance

core.title: Unlock your team's potential
core.description:
Have you ever attended meetings that are inconclusive? Have you ever worked without knowing the objectives and deadlines? Have you ever been involved in in a team that does not cooperate or is in conflict?

In this pill you will learn what "the key of a winning team" are, to transform a diverse set of people in a close-knit team that is capable of achieving the desired objectives. The right keys will unlock your group’s potential and make you a winning team.

metadata.summary: Create synergy by harnessing the unique talents of your team members, so they complement each other.

Discover the steps of the creative process, and the many techniques that will allow you to sprout and then concretize your ideas, alone or in groups. So, ready to wake up the inner creative?

core.title: Unconscious Bias 101
core.description:
When did you quickly judge someone you just met, perhaps without realising it?

Every organisation aims to attract diverse talent and build high-performing teams. Yet, hidden mental processes can hinder effective collaboration with different people.

These processes are unconscious biases - automatic social stereotypes formed without our awareness. The challenge is acknowledging that everyone has unconscious bias; no one is an exception.

metadata.summary: Identify common types of biases and how bias affects workplace decisions.
learning_outcomes: Define and explain what unconscious bias is
Recognise how it affects workplace decisions
Understand how unconscious bias affects our decisions
Identify common types of bias
Apply strategies to disrupt unconscious bias

skills.name: Awareness of negative effects of diversity training

core.title: Transform SILOs into Collaboration - Interactive
core.description:
(Updated Nov 2024)

Transforming SILOS into Collaboration is part of the Cutting Edge Communication Comedy Series. Short, sharp and entertaining with simple messages and skills for breaking down SILO thinking and building collaborative teams. In the video case study, Marcus the manager, encourages the team to break out of its SILO – Stuck Inside a Limited Outlook, and learn to share. Learn to avoid a closed fragmented culture and ensure caring, sharing and collaboration.

 

Key Learning Points

  • Don't remain closed and stuck INSTEAD: Take time to build the team
  • Don't focus only on your needs INSTEAD: Listen and share
  • Don't work in fragmented groups INSTEAD: Develop talent and work together
  • Don't get defensive about change INSTEAD: Create a unified open culture


Comedy makes learning fun

This interactive course is part of the popular Cutting Edge Communication Comedy Series created by Psychologist Eve Ash and comedienne Erin Brown starring Emmy-award winning Kim Estes. This powerful training series follows several characters as they battle challenges, negotiate conflicts and learn from mistakes about professionalism, leadership, communication and safety. This Australian produced series was filmed on location in Los Angeles.

core.title: Training for Non-Trainers Module
core.description:
Employees are often required to learn new skills, and you may be the one to teach them. However, you don't have to be a professional trainer to deliver a training session. This course will look at different training methods and the pros and cons of each, as well as guiding you through the process of creating a lesson plan, which is essential for any training session.

In addition to a high quality video, this Module features expanded learning content blocks and a short quiz to check your understanding.

metadata.summary: A module aimed at studying the pros and cons of different training methods and the steps in creating a lesson plan.
learning_outcomes: Identifying training needs and objectives.
Common training methods and how to select the right one for your needs.
How to create an effective lesson plan.

core.title: Trabajando desde casa - Para empleados y profesionistas independientes
core.description: La crisis sanitaria obligó a un número extraordinario de empresas e instituciones a cerrar e implementar en conjunto con sus colaboradores modalidades de trabajo en casa. En su mayoría, ni empleadores ni empleados estaban preparados para ello. Este breve curso interactivo brinda información al empleado acerca de sus responsabilidades y consejos sobre cómo puede trabajar de manera productiva, segura y efectiva en esta circunstancia extraordinaria.

learning_outcomes: Trabajar desde casa y sus ventajas
Establecer expectativas claras
Crear un entorno de trabajo productivo: espacio adecuado, gestión de horarios y tecnología
Evitar distracciones
Lograr el equilibrio trabajo / vida personal

core.title: Time Management Skills for Employees
core.description:
Course Overview

This training presentation will help you gain control over your time so that you can work more efficiently and productively.

 

Learning Objectives


At the end of the training session, you will be able to:


  • Identify and eliminate your time wasters.
  • Plan and prioritize effectively.
  • Define goals and make time-wise decisions.
  • Capitalize on prime and commuting time.
  • Avoid procrastination.
  • Handle communications, interruptions, and emergencies effectively.

 

Duration


19 minutes

core.title: Thinking about team development
core.description: Understand the importance of people development within your organization with this team development course and explore different conversational strategies to bring the best out of your team.

learning_outcomes: Identify the importance of people development within your organization
Understand the need for developmental conversations with your employees
Identify and apply a conversation strategy that suits you best
Understand and apply the procedure for training needs analysis
Help your employees by training and coaching them directly or facilitating a similar experience

core.title: The situational skills of the manager
core.description:
When managers come face-to-face with a problem they must take into account all of the aspects involved (e.g. human corporate culture or social environment) and how these aspects interact. Now more than ever managers are confronted with complex situations where traditional troubleshooting methods are not applicable. Systems thinking enables you to address these complex situations effectively.

In addition to describing the theory of systems thinking this module will provide concrete answers to your operational problems.

This course will cover:

  • The basic principles of systems thinking.
  • Using systems thinking to assess a situation or conflict.
  • Managing different managerial situations effectively.

Target Audience

Experienced managers who want to master the basics of management.

Accreditation

PMI accreditation: earn 0.5 PDU points from PMI.

metadata.summary: An effective, comprehensive analysis model to help you deal with complex situations.
learning_outcomes: How to use systems thinking to manage effectively by assessing the nature of a problem and improving your understanding of the different levels of a situation

core.title: The relational skills of the manager - Part A
core.description:
A manager’s activities mainly involve receiving information communicating transmitting knowledge and helping individuals and teams with their methodology and decision-making. 

These fundamental activities can only be carried out successfully via an appropriate communication system. An effective manager therefore needs to use the appropriate means of communication and make best use of time spent in contact with the team.

This course will cover:

  • Developing an adequate communication and information system. 
  • Communicating consistently and based on the team’s needs. 
  • Preparing for and leading a team meeting successfully.

Target Audience

Any manager who wants to acquire the basics of management.

Prerequisites

There are no prerequisites, but it is recommended that you also complete Part B of this course.

Accreditation

PMI accreditation: earn 0.5 PDU points from PMI.

metadata.summary: Communication tools and practical exercises to help you prepare for and lead fluid, effective team meetings.
learning_outcomes: How to communicate effectively with your coworkers, selecting the right tools and adapting to the imperatives of the situation and the team's needs
How to prepare for and lead a meeting effectively

core.title: The management styles
core.description:
Managers have to deal with a range of different situations from co-workers with different skills and motivations to circumstances with varying imperatives and degrees of urgency. Managers must constantly adapt. Intuition experience and personality are not enough on their own.

Instead managers must be conscious of their preferences strengths and weaknesses and constantly adjust their behavior. They need to assess risks and develop their interpersonal and organizational strengths if they want to succeed. This module will help you understand the different options and adopt the appropriate behavior.

This course will cover:

  • Recognizing and differentiating between different management styles.
  • Adopting the positive aspects of each management style.
  • Adapting your management style to the circumstances: contextual management

Target Audience

All managers.

Accreditation

PMI accreditation: earn 0.5 PDU points from PMI.

metadata.summary: Practical case studies will help you optimize the way in which you manage each coworker.
learning_outcomes: How to adopt an effective management style, capitalizing on your strengths
Specifically tailor your management style to different circumstances and coworkers

core.title: The emotional skills of the manager
core.description:
Traditionally emotions have long been banned from the workplace as can be seen by expressions such as “leave your emotions at the door”.

In reality emotions are constantly present at work. By managing your own emotions and by maintaining emotional equilibrium you learn to manage situations objectively and clearly. Emotional intelligence is an essential management skill. 

This course will cover:

  • Analyzing emotional mechanisms.
  • Identifying and managing your emotions.
  • Managing emotionally charged situations effectively.

Target Audience

Experienced managers who want to master the basics of management.

Accreditation

PMI accreditation: earn 0.5 PDU points from PMI.

metadata.summary: Discover how emotions impact managerial effectiveness and how to recognize and respond to emotions effectively.
learning_outcomes: How to become a better manager by managing your own emotions
Identifying your emotional profile to be better equipped to anticipate sensitive situations
Be better able to build on the positive effects of emotions by understanding how emotions work

core.title: The Silo Effect
core.description: When people protect their own skills, knowledge or team instead of working together, the resulting silos can have a negative impact on the organization.

metadata.summary: Discover how not working together can result in silos and have a negative impact on the organisation.
learning_outcomes: Why analysing the culture of an organisation can increase creativity
How the expertise of one person can dramatically improve the success of an organisation
How putting information together can lead to great innovations

core.title: The Pillars of Leadership Lesson 3: Communication
core.description: In order to lead a company or team towards goals, you must connect with people. This course focuses on the importance of communicating with genuine interest, having discovery conversations, and helping others achieve their goals and use their capabilities. This course gives leaders and managers the ability to initiate meaningful and powerful conversations with anyone in the organization. This series is based on Jason Jennings' bestselling books on leadership and extensive research into what makes successful leaders.

core.title: The COACH Model
core.description:
Coaching is a process, which the leaders use to help employees become more independent. There are many coaching programs available to managers these days. The COACH Model is a five-step program that walks a leader through the process of coaching an associate from setting a goal to measuring their success at the end of the process.

core.title: Situational Leadership Theory
core.description:
Today’s business environment is global, generationally diverse, collaborative, cross-functional, and constantly changing. Leaders who believe that they can achieve organizational goals using just one leadership style will not succeed. The most effective leaders learn how to flexibly adapt multiple leadership styles to guide their employees, achieve their goals, and build strong teams.
A popular management theory called Situational Leadership, first developed in 1969 by Dr. Paul Hersey and Kenneth Blanchard, remains especially relevant in today’s business environment. This theory is based on the premise that because organizations are not made up of workers who are equally skilled and motivated, leaders should manage team members according to their individual abilities and developmental readiness. We’ll review their method, and then suggest some ways you can use it to manage today’s business challenges.

 

Accreditation

core.title: Resistant Vs. Open to Change
core.description:
“Change is the only constant in life.” -Heraclitus, a Greek philosopher As a leader, you’re responsible for leading your team to achieve organizational goals. Sometimes that involves changing processes, adopting new technologies, or learning new skills. What do you do when one or more of your employees refuse to change and grow with the rest of the team? People tend to approach change in one of the two ways. They either embrace change and are excited about the possibilities and opportunities inherent in a new adventure. Or they resist change because they fear the unknown. As a leader, you probably have employees in both camps. In this course, we will discuss how to influence the change resisters.


Accreditation

0.25 hours, Continuing Education Units (CEU) from the HR Certificate Institute (HRCI)

0.25 hours, Continuing Education Units (CEU) from the Society for Human Resource Management (SHRM)

metadata.summary: Learn how to identify the fear of change and implement a T-chart
learning_outcomes: Identify the fear for change
Implement T-chart

core.title: Resilience: Strategies to become a resilient leader (Part 2 of 5)
core.description:
Problems and setbacks are inevitable in the workplace—an effective leader needs to know how to stay resilient during a crisis. Resilience is a crucial characteristic of high-performing leaders. Leaders must cultivate it in themselves in order to advance and thrive.

They also carry the responsibility of helping to protect the energy of the people in their teams. Leadership is sustainable only if individuals and teams are able to consistently recover high energy levels.

learning_outcomes: Explore the characteristics of a resilient leader
Discover strategies you can use to increase your own resilience
Understand what conflict management is and why it matters
Identify common sources of conflict and get tips on how to manage your response

core.title: Resilience: Staying adaptable and resilient (Part 3 of 5)
core.description:
Why does adaptability matter? To start, organizations want to know that they can rely on employees to navigate changes effectively. But adaptability doesn’t just benefit the organization. Your poise and resourcefulness when facing challenges can impact your short- and long-term professional success.

Adaptability suggests a sense of autonomy, of consciously navigating circumstances as opposed to letting them drive you.

learning_outcomes: Learn about adaptability at work and why it matters
Five key skills that every adaptable person needs and get tips to boost your adaptability
Understand how to gain the courage to take the first step out of your comfort zone

core.title: Resilience: Personal resilience (Part 1 of 5)
core.description:
That ability to bounce back may seem to come naturally to some, but in fact, it’s like playing an instrument or learning a language. While we may have some innate tendencies toward resilience, music, or language, they’re all skills anyone can build with practice.

Individual resilience entails attitudes, behaviors, and deeds that advance psychological and physical well-being. It’s easy to dismiss the importance of self-awareness, especially as it relates to resilience. But your ability to weather challenges is tied to your ability to know and understand yourself.

learning_outcomes: Understand why resilience promotes positive outcomes
Five characteristics, or pillars, you can strengthen to become more resilient
Learn about the link between self-awareness and resilience
Explore solutions that can help you to develop both

core.title: Remote Working 101 (CPD certified)
core.description:
The world is changing fast. Many of us are working from home for the first time and discovering the challenges this can bring.

Whether you’re a total newbie or remote working veteran, you will benefit from these 10 essential lessons prepared by iAM Learning to support businesses during these turbulent and difficult times. Skills that will keep you productive and help to support your wellbeing.

This course is CPD certified.

 

Target Audience

General Audience / All Levels

metadata.summary: Master the challenges of working from home with these tips to help you maintain your wellbeing and productivity
learning_outcomes: Tips on mental health, anxiety, depression, low mood, personal productivity and time management

core.title: Remote Working (Global)
core.description:
Do you work remotely? This 25 minute module will help you maximise the benefits of remote working, while minimising the potential negative impacts it may have on mental and physical wellbeing, productivity, communication, and leadership.

After completing the module, you’ll be able to:

  • Define clear strategies you can use to transition from a shared workplace to a remote workplace;
  • Physically and mentally prepare yourself for safe remote work;
  • Communicate effectively and maintain social bonds with co-workers while in physical isolation;
  • Understand and abide by your organisation’s policies regarding IT security, codes of conduct, and WHS;
  • Maximise your productivity while working remotely; and
  • Lead/play a role in a team culture of innovation, communication, and collaboration while spatially distributed.

Während der Reise - So vermeiden Sie Komplikationen: Ankunft Im Hotel Verhalten vor Ort Im Straßenverkehr
Spezielle Situationen - So verhalten Sie sich im Ernstfall: Allgemeine Hinweise Kriminalität Gesellschaftliche Unruhen Terrorismus Naturkatastrophen

core.title: Quality and Continuous Improvement
core.description: This course introduces the core principles of quality and continuous improvement, focusing on their significance and application in the workplace. Learn essential concepts and strategies to foster a quality and continuous improvement culture that enhances products, services, and processes. We will examine promoting a workplace culture of innovation, adaptability, and excellence that drives sustainable growth and competitiveness.

learning_outcomes: Gain a clear understanding of what quality means and why it is crucial for organisational success.
Explore the concepts of breakthrough and continuous improvement, and learn how they contribute to achieving and maintaining high standards.
Learn how to implement the principles of Total Quality Management (TQM) to enhance organisational processes, products, and services.

core.description: Solving complex problems does not come naturally. When trying to tackle challenging business issues or transform opportunities, even experienced business leaders sometimes make terrible mistakes. The reason is simple: while the ability to solve problems is critical for success, most of us lack a disciplined approach. In this course, Professors Bernard Garrette and Olivier Sibony, co-authors of the bookCracked it!, will teach you how to develop better solutions and how to sell them more effectively.

Consider a non-analytical approach to problem solving

core.title: Problem Solving: Four Stages of Creative Problem Solving (Part 2 of 5)
core.description: Once you have recognized a problem, how do you solve it most effectively? In this course, you will learn the stages of problem-solving and discover what characteristics you need to consider when solving a problem. We will also demonstrate how you can verify that your problem has been resolved by evaluation and questions.

learning_outcomes: How to apply effective problem SOLVER™ behaviors and attitudes
The four stages of a systematic problem-solving process

core.title: Problem Solving: Early Problem Recognition (Part 1 of 5)
core.description: The earlier you can recognize when you are off course, the faster you can find the correct solution. Problem recognition occurs when you become aware of a gap between where you are and where you want to be. In this lesson, we will guide you to proactively look for hidden problems using tools such as a gap analysis, surveys and interviews. You will understand what you can do to initiate problem recognition, how you can gather data, and how to unpack a problem.

learning_outcomes: How to define a problem
How to recognize early symptoms of common problems
How to initiate a formal problem recognition process

core.title: Problem Solving: Defining Problems Accurately (Part 3 of 5)
core.description: Defining a problem accurately is essential for correctly solving it; definitions provide a target, boundary, description and measure of success.This course will show you how to accurately define a problem using various techniques and how to solve the root cause of a problem. You will discover why most problems exist and understand the difference between cause and effect.

learning_outcomes: The importance of accurate problem definition
Nine ways to accurately define problems
How to analyze and identify root causes

core.title: Problem Solving: Crisis Resolution (Part 5 of 5)
core.description: Crisis resolution is a critical skill for any organization to make sure your brand is in control. A crisis is an urgent demand for change that must be addressed immediately. In this course, you will learn how to identify the main cause of a crisis and prevent, manage and eliminate negative impacts. You will discover the six steps to crisis resolution and how to ensure that you learn from a crisis.

learning_outcomes: The difference between a crisis and a problem
The main causes of crisis
The six steps to crisis resolution

Unfortunately he knows that the action of this team's workload is tense! He goes to see Sarah-nicknamed the Ace of the negotiations in the company-to know how to prepare for the negotiation.

core.description:
Course Overview

Planning and organizing are two of the key functions performed by any manager or supervisor. That makes good planning and organizing skills an extremely important asset.


Learning Objectives

  • How you can become better organized so that you can become more efficient and stop wasting valuable time
  • How to develop better plans so that you can achieve goals and be more successful

Daten abzugreifen oder Endgeräte mit Schadsoftware zu infizieren. Phishing heißt die Methode, um an sensible Daten zu kommen. Auch an Ihrem Arbeitsplatz sind Sie davor nicht sicher.

core.description: A majority of successful cyber attacks begin with phishing emails. These social engineering attacks are delivered via malicious links, file attachments, and login forms. core.title: Performance Management: Conducting Effective Performance Reviews & Handling Difficult Reactions to Feedback (Part 2 of 5)
core.description:
Effective performance reviews and managing difficult reactions require a combination of preparation, open communication, empathy, and a focus on constructive feedback. These practices can lead to more productive discussions and improved employee performance and satisfaction.

One of the top reasons managers avoid giving feedback is that they’re afraid of employees’ reactions.
So, how should you handle these situations? What should you say? And how can you still create a positive outcome from a feedback conversation gone wrong?

learning_outcomes: How to prepare for and conduct a performance review that’s motivating for your team and improves their overall performance
Best practices to handle five of the most common, and most difficult, reactions to feedback
Build confidence in handling the worst-case scenarios professionally and effectively

core.description:
Course Description

Being good at interacting with others can really help you at your job and in everyday life. But what exactly are people skills? In this course well look at everything from emotional intelligence to conflict resolution and ensure your confidence with anyone is at maximum levels.

 

Target Audience

core.title: PEACE and Respect – Interactive
core.description:
(Updated Oct 2024)

PEACE and Respect is a course to help teams and individuals ensure a greater awareness and collaboration. This is especially important where teams comprise different temperaments and behaviors which can cause disagreements, resentment or stress. The presence of differences should not be our main focus but rather how best to work together despite differences. In this course psychologist Eve Ash explains how we can improve communication, respect and caring by creating and maintaining PEACE, a five part strategy. Focusing on the PEACE approach is an important way to improve how we work together, to change competition or even conflict into collaborative problem-solving.

learning_outcomes: Focus on PEACE as a way to build respect and suspend judgment – Positivity, Empathy, Awareness, Collaboration and Enlightenment
Demonstrate positivity by signaling positive emotions which others mirror
Show empathy by being sensitive to other people's feelings, and making an effort to listen and understand
Develop awareness by building your understanding of people and respecting differences and rights
Collaborate by listening and giving space to others and finding common ground
Enlighten others by sharing your knowledge and insights

core.title: Organisational Strategy
core.description:
All companies need a vision, a mission, and values if they are to have guidelines for their employees to follow. An organisational strategy decides how those are to be communicated within the company, with clear steps on how to accomplish the company’s targets.
The strategy shapes what the organisation is, who it serves, what it does and why it does it.
Once the session is complete, you will be able to describe what a company’s vision is, how it links to the mission and what your role is in making it come alive.

learning_outcomes: Contrast the vision, mission and values of an organisation
Describe your company’s strategies to accomplish its goals
Explain what organisational design is.

core.title: Operations Management
core.description:
Today’s marketplace is fast-paced and ultra-competitive. Operations departments should be the same. They can’t afford to be wasteful, slow, or out of touch with their customers’ needs if they hope to compete and thrive. In order to achieve and maintain a competitive edge in the global economy and maximize corporate profits, successful operations management systems need to be engineered to quickly respond to customer’s requests, promptly adapt to new processes and product requirements, and rapidly embrace new technologies. No wonder Forbes magazine reports that 75% of CEOs come from an operations background. Having a comprehensive understanding of how an organization works is a leadership advantage.


Accreditation

0.25 hours, Continuing Education Units (CEU) from the HR Certificate Institute (HRCI)

0.25 hours, Continuing Education Units (CEU) from the Society for Human Resource Management (SHRM)

metadata.summary: Define operations management, make operational decisions, and improve operations continuously.
learning_outcomes: Define operations management
Make operational decisions
Improve operations continuously

core.title: Office Ergonomics
core.description:
A recent ergonomics study found that on average, adults spent roughly 39 hours per week at work — with people employed in more sedentary occupations spending 22 hours a week sitting. It's frightening to think that with incorrect ergonomics, people are slowly but surely damaging their bodies for over 1000 hours on any year. Well fear not, because we've got our best man (or dummy) on the case! Follow Crash T. Dummy as he puts his body on the line so we don't have to. Welcome to Undercover Dummy: Office Ergonomics.

Business Objectives

This course empowers your organisation to identify and address the causes of poor office ergonomics by providing them with information that enables them to correctly set up and utilise their office workstation. By implementing the lessons in this course, they'll save themselves from years of potentially serious musculoskeletal injuries later in life.

Audience

The ViaUp Office Ergonomics course is designed to benefit businesses and organisations of any size. It empowers your employees to confidently set up and operate their office equipment in the safest manner.

Course Outline

  • Welcome
  • What's At Risk?
  • Your Chair
  • Your Workstation
  • Exercises
  • Complete

Difficulty:Easy

Subject Matter Expert

N/A

Features:

  • Engaging 2D animated video content
  • Immersive 2D scenarios
  • A unique, intuitive course navigation and menu structure.

learning_outcomes: The risks associated with poor ergonomics
How to correctly set up your workstation to prevent injury, and
The simple exercises you can do throughout the day to keep you healthy and active

core.title: Offene Feedback-Kultur (Open feedback culture)

metadata.summary: Lernen Sie, Feedback anzunehmen, zu verstehen, zu geben und zu bewerten – denn die Vorteile dadurch sind unermesslich.

Feedback anzunehmen, zu verstehen und in vier einfachen Schritten zu geben

core.title: Negotiation: Psychology and communication techniques - Part 1
core.description: Negotiation is a bit like a game of chess. Each player lines up their pawns, hoping to win the game. But no one wants to end up checkmated. So how can you keep calm in every situation? How can you avoid descending into futile power games? Anger is never a wise counsellor, so it's best to adopt a softer approach. This course will help you maintain quality relationships and turn situations to your own advantage!

Defuse anger to preserve quality of dialogue
Respect your interlocutor in order to prevent them losing face

core.title: Negotiation: Planning Effective Negotiations
core.description: Negotiation is a skill required in many areas of business, and it takes a lot of training to build this skill. In this lesson, we explore ways to increase your currency power before negotiating to leverage buying power. We will guide you how to use ten effective behavioral traits of successful negotiators and how to apply six planning tactics.

metadata.summary: Join this course to learn how effective negotiators proactively plan for negotiations in order to achieve better outcomes. We will cover the behavioural traits of successful negotiators and explain how you can incorporate these into your own negotiation strategies.
learning_outcomes: The questions that need answers before negotiating
Three types of currencies to negotiate and how to increase your currency power
Six planning tactics for negotiations

core.title: Negotiation: Opening Win-Win Discussions
core.description: Negotiation is a skill required in many areas of business, and it takes a lot of training to build this skill. In this lesson, you will discover how to open discussions with a positive attitude, keeping an atmosphere of trust and cooperation. We will explore how to use collaborative win-win negotiation to satisfy the needs of both parties.

metadata.summary: Far too often, people look at negotiations as a battle where they aim to extract as much value as possible from the other side. This course will show you why structuring negotiations to produce win-win outcomes will help you grow your business in the long term. You'll learn techniques to approach negotiations positively and foster an atmosphere of trust and cooperation in your negotiations.
learning_outcomes: The steps for opening a discussion
Four ways to build high-trust, positive client relationships
Five criteria for high-quality negotiations
Win-win alternatives to positional bargaining

core.title: Negotiation: Introduction to Negotiation and Strategy
core.description: Negotiation is a skill required in many areas of business, and it takes a lot of training to build this skill. Negotiation is necessary in sales when a buyer and seller can’t agree. After this course, you will understand the two strategies to negotiate and how to use a variety of techniques to increase your personal negotiating power. We will unpack each step of the negotiation process and guide you through all you need to know to master any negotiation.

metadata.summary: Negotiation is a crucial skill for all business professionals, not just those in sales or business development. Good negotiations should focus on building long-term relationships and creating value for both parties. The course will explore common negotiation techniques and strategies and give you the skills you need to become better at negotiations in your personal and professional life.
learning_outcomes: Key negotiation concepts and how they may be used to resolve conflict
How to identify opportunities for negotiation
Two win-win negotiation strategies you can apply

core.title: Negotiation: Exploring Win-Win Alternatives
core.description: Negotiation is a skill required in many areas of business, and it takes a lot of training to build this skill. Exploring alternatives is a problem-solving stage of negotiation. In this lesson, you will learn how to pinpoint areas of agreement, conflict, limitations and common ground. You will also understand how to encourage seeking an agreement but compromise if necessary.

metadata.summary: This course will cover how you can explore alternative solutions in negotiations to produce win-win outcomes. You will discover how to pinpoint areas of agreement and isolate areas of conflict. You will aso learn strategies to uncover your buyer's price limitations to better understand the scope of negotiation.

How to work defensively with “offensive” buyer gambits

core.title: Negotiation seen through the lens of neuroscience - Part 2
core.description: Negotiation of any kind is a complex exercise. A source of apprehension for some, a stimulating challenge for others, it requires impeccable preparation that leaves nothing to chance. Fortunately, neuroscience can help us put the odds on our side! So do not hesitate, take this course to find out more about the factors, conscious or not, that affect our decisions, and to discover how to use them to your advantage (and wisely!) during a negotiation.

core.title: Negotiation seen through the lens of neuroscience - Part 1
core.description: Negotiation of any kind is a complex exercise. A source of apprehension for some, a stimulating challenge for others, it requires impeccable preparation that leaves nothing to chance. Fortunately, neuroscience can help us put the odds on our side! So do not hesitate, take this course to find out more about the factors, conscious or not, that affect our decisions, and to discover how to use them to your advantage (and wisely!) during a negotiation.

tags: Rethink your negotiating techniques in the light of advances in neuroscience
Capitalize on neuroselling in your commercial negotiations
learning_outcomes: Rethink your negotiating techniques in the light of advances in neuroscience
Capitalize on neuroselling in your commercial negotiations

core.title: Negotiation Skills Module
core.description:
The aim of negotiation is for the parties to reach a win-win agreement, but how can you ensure that you get a good deal, not a bad one? This module explores the six phases of negotiation (preparation and planning, opening, exploring, testing, bargaining, and closing) and will equip you with the knowledge to carry out effective negotiations.

In addition to a high quality video, this Module features expanded learning content blocks and a short quiz to check your understanding.

metadata.summary: Learn to create win-win agreements in negotiations through this comprehensive look at the six phases of negotiation.
learning_outcomes: The 6 stages of a negotiation and the key things to focus on at each.
How to improve your success in achieving a mutually beneficial outcome when preparing for and carrying out negotiations.

core.title: Negotiation Skills
core.description:
Course Overview

Negotiation is something we’ve all done at one time or another.

Whilst we are not taught negotiation at school, it is a valuable skill to master, particularly in the workplace.

Course consists of 8 minutes of video content combined with
assessment questions and interactivity.

 

Learning Objectives

In this video based eLearning program you are shown a sales negotiation between an account manager and an office manager.

Through the scenario you will learn:

  • The importance of preparation
  • Tips for handling objections
  • Importance of questioning

 

Target Audience

Aimed at all levels of management and aspiring sales staff.

 

Duration

10-15 mins

core.title: Negotiating for Success - Interactive
core.description:
(Updated Nov 2024)

Determine what’s most important to you both. Work together to achieve that result. This interactive course is designed to help people improve their businesses, manage change and develop projects through negotiation and lobbying skills. Learn to have a positive impact when trying to pitch ideas and influence stakeholders, clients and governments for change and growth.

 

Casey and Sam demonstrate skills, but best negotiators are Carol and Steve. You don’t have to be born with negotiation skills, but it helps to know how these can be improved. Steve suggests knowing your bottom line position but also knowing what to give way on and by how much. Serena and Marcus discuss aspects of effective negotiation. Sam “negotiates” his employment contract with Casey, who accedes to all his demands. Carol by contrast is tough when Sam negotiates with her. At all times, Steve advises staying positive and assured, even when the outcome is not all that you’d hoped for.

Key Learning Points

  • Don’t overlook preparation INSTEAD: Determine your position
  • Don’t bully or overreact INSTEAD: Listen positively and acknowledge
  • Don’t assume it will be unpleasant INSTEAD: Engage, enjoy, give and take
  • Don’t beg, plead or threaten INSTEAD: Stay positive and resilient


Comedy makes learning fun

This interactive course is part of the Cutting Edge Communication Comedy Series created by Psychologist Eve Ash and comedienne Erin Brown starring Emmy-award winning Kim Estes. A powerful training series follows several characters through a landscape of social faux pas insult and embarrassment. This series will amaze and entertrain covering important lessons in human interaction motivation leadership service unprofessional behavior apologizing negotiating stress difficult people among many other workplace hot button issues. This Australian produced series was filmed on location in Los Angeles.

core.title: Motivation Masterclass
core.description:
How to motivate others to improve performance is a question that perplexes and mystifies managers more than most. In this course, you'll learn the main theories around motivation and how you can facilitate the needs for motivation that people have.

This lesson forms part of the Management Skills Award course.

metadata.summary: Master the fine art of motivation to help your employees reach their full potential in the workplace
learning_outcomes: The core principles of 5 major theories on what drives and motivates people
The 4 areas of motivation that drive almost all behaviours and how each can be met
How you can create the conditions for your employees to be motivated, empowered, and inspired

core.title: Motivating Employees
core.description:
How do you get your employees and team members motivated and actively engaged? According to the dictionary, you simply provide them with a need, desire, or reason to make a particular choice - or behave in a specific manner. Sounds simple, right? Unfortunately, motivating employees is much more than just offering the right prizes, bonuses, or incentives.

To understand motivation, we'll first focus on making sure the foundational needs of your employees are being met, and then, look at what additional needs need to be taken care of to help them thrive. Finally, you'll learn how to assess the motivation level of your employees to better determine what types of programs, incentives, or changes should be put in place to effectively increase motivation within your organization. 

Learning Objectives

  • Identify the 8 motivational requirements of most individuals
  • Assess your employees' motivational level to determine your next steps
  • Develop an action plan that identifies and introduces meaningful motivating activities

Time to complete

25 minutes

metadata.summary: You may think motivating employees is easy, but doing so successfully is about much more than prizes and incentives. This course focuses on how to meet all of your employees needs, from their most foundational needs to additional, more nuanced needs that will help them to thrive. By the end of the course, you will understand which new initiatives you should put in place to better motivate your employees.
learning_outcomes: The importance of understanding motivation on a deeper level
How to recognise the full range of needs your employees have
New initiatives and programs you can introduce to more effectively motivate your employees

core.title: Motivar A Un Compañero De Trabajo – Interactivo (Motivate a Co-worker – Spanish)
core.description:
A pesar de los buenos consejos para motivar a los equipos, siempre hay alguien que no rinde bien y/o frena a los demás. Peter Quarry, experto en psicología, recomienda no esperar a que la dirección rectifique el problema, sino implicar a esas personas.

Este curso le mostrará cómo motivar a los compañeros de trabajo involucrándolos y respondiendo a ellos, averiguando sus necesidades y no excluyéndolos.

learning_outcomes: Identificar qué atraerá a esa persona
Buscar su participación e ideas
Preguntar qué necesitan y ofrecerles tu apoyo
Ofrecer ayuda, sin castigarlos ni excluirles

core.description:
This online Modern Slavery Training will provide understanding on the various terms that ‘modern slaver’ covers and understand what slavery is. Learners will also find out what their organisation can do to help eliminate slavery in the UK.

core.title: Meeting for Results – Improve Your Meetings (Interactive)
core.description:
(Updated Nov 2024)

We all need meetings that are positive and productive, with opportunities to communicate and share information on projects, activities and policies and set goals, agree on improvement strategies and solve problems or disputes. In the case study from the Cutting Edge team, Marcus has an idiosyncratic approach to conducting meetings which usually frustrates the staff. Sam recommends setting meeting goals, and having a specific time frame for each agenda item. The team learn to respond to flagging energy levels, respect meeting rules and respect each other.

Learn that the schedule, purpose and agenda of a meeting should be clear, participants should be prepared and everyone should participate. Meetings should start and end on time, and follow up actions should be clearly stated and agreed. Learn that valuing peoples input and encouraging constructive behavior makes for an improved meeting atmosphere as does summarizing key points and listing actions as you go.

 

Key Learning Points

  • Don’t meet without clear goals INSTEAD: Set agenda and control time
  • Don’t lose group energy INSTEAD: Make it engaging
  • Don’t cultivate negativity INSTEAD: Manage conflict respectfully
  • Don’t leave loose ends INSTEAD: Ensure actions and outcomes

Comedy makes learning fun

This interactive course is part of the popular Cutting Edge Communication Comedy Series created by Psychologist Eve Ash and comedienne Erin Brown starring Emmy-award winning Kim Estes. This powerful training series follows several characters as they battle challenges, negotiate conflicts and learn from mistakes about professionalism, leadership, communication and safety. This Australian produced series was filmed on location in Los Angeles.

core.title: McKinsey’s 7-S Change Model
core.description:
McKinsey’s 7-S model was created by McKinsey consultants Robert Waterman, Tom Peters, Richard Pascale, and Anthony Athos. It provides a framework to plan and execute mid-term organizational change. It is based on the premise that organizations perform properly when seven key elements are aligned.

The seven key elements are structure, strategy, systems, skills, style, staff, and shared values. The model is most often used as an organizational analysis tool to assess and monitor changes in the internal situation of an organization.

Accreditation

0.25 hours, Continuing Education Units (CEU) from the Society for Human Resource Management (SHRM)

0.25 hours, Continuing Education Units (CEU) from the HR Certificate Institute (HRCI)

metadata.summary: Recognize seven elements of McKinsey’s change model
learning_outcomes: List the seven elements of McKinsey’s change model
Identify the hard and soft elements of the factors of change
Use the model to change organizational behavior
State the advantages and disadvantages of the model

core.title: Mastering MongoDB 7.0
core.description:
Mastering MongoDB 7.0 explores the latest version of MongoDB, an exceptional NoSQL database solution that aligns with the needs of modern web applications. This book starts with an informative overview of MongoDB's architecture and developer tools, guiding you through the process of connecting to databases seamlessly.
This MongoDB book explores advanced queries in detail, including aggregation pipelines and multi-document ACID transactions. It delves into the capabilities of the MongoDB Atlas developer data platform and the latest features, such as Atlas Vector Search, and their role in AI applications, enabling developers to build applications with the scalability and performance that today's organizations need. It also covers the creation of resilient search functionality using MongoDB Atlas Search. Mastering MongoDB 7.0's deep coverage of advanced techniques encompasses everything from role-based access control (RBAC) to user management, auditing practices, and encryption across data, network, and storage layers.
By the end of this book, you'll have developed the skills necessary to create efficient, secure, and high-performing applications using MongoDB. You'll have the confidence to undertake complex queries, integrate robust applications, and ensure data security to overcome modern data challenges.

learning_outcomes: Execute advanced MongoDB queries for intricate data insights
Harness the power of aggregation pipelines to transform data
Ensure data integrity with multi-document ACID transactions
Optimize query performance using strategic indexing techniques
Navigate MongoDB Atlas seamlessly for monitoring and backups
Enable robust search functionality with Atlas Search
Master RBAC, user management, and data encryption for security
Implement auditing practices for transparency and accountability

core.title: Managing conflict at workplace
core.description: Learn how to identify different types of workplace stress, their common causes and behaviours exhibited due to stress. This course is designed to help you empathize with your colleagues and deal with conflicts with a better understanding of likely causes and solutions.

learning_outcomes: Identify what is workplace stress.
Identify the most common causes of workplace stress.
Identify the behaviors exhibited due to workplace stress.
Practice solutions to negate employee stress.
Explain what workplace conflicts are.
Recognize a conflict at the workplace when there is one.
Resolve the conflict a workplace to the best of your abilities.

core.title: Managing cognitive biases - Part 3
core.description: At work, you have to make decisions of varying importance on a daily basis. It probably seems so natural to you that you do not feel any need to adopt a particular method to do it. Like everyone else, though, you are subject to cognitive biases that lead you astray even when you are not aware of the fact. And like everyone else, you regularly make predictable mistakes ... Fortunately, it is possible to learn how to decide better! In this course designed with Professor Olivier Sibony, you will learn more about the most common mistakes of this type, and you will discover a method to improve the quality of your decisions.

tags: Understand the importance of having a decision-making method
Identify the means required to establish a constructive dialogue
Apply techniques to change one’s viewing angle
learning_outcomes: Understand the importance of having a decision-making method
Identify the means required to establish a constructive dialogue
Apply techniques to change one’s viewing angle

core.title: Managing a Cross-Functional Team
core.description:
Teams are the backbone of contemporary business life. Executive teams, work teams, cross-functional teams, high-performance teams, and project teams serve a variety of purposes, but they all have the same goal: to solidify the organization’s competitive advantage in the marketplace. Cross-functional team leaders draw individuals from departments across the organization to address a particular problem. They might select development engineers, marketing professionals, sales people, legal experts, customer service managers, accountants, and HR executives to apply their various talents to accomplish the goal. The concept is powerful. But this mix of diverse skill sets, professional experience, and personalities also comes with challenges—and you need to manage the team carefully in order to maximize its potential for success.


Accreditation

0.25 hours, Continuing Education Units (CEU) from the HR Certificate Institute (HRCI)

0.25 hours, Continuing Education Units (CEU) from the Society for Human Resource Management (SHRM)

metadata.summary: Recognize and state the challenges of handling a diverse team.
learning_outcomes: State the challenges of handling a diverse team
List the ways to manage these challenges
Apply the strategies to leverage the power of your team

core.title: Managing Virtual Teams Module
core.description:
Virtual teams work independently on a shared organisational purpose using a range of technologies to communicate and collaborate, and they are becoming more and more common in many organisations. This module looks at the benefits and challenges of working in a virtual team, the importance of a clear communication plan, and the role of the manager in ensuring the teams success.

In addition to a high quality video, this Module features expanded learning content blocks and a short quiz to check your understanding.

metadata.summary: This module thoroughly explores the benefits and challenges of a virtual team and how to conduct it successfully.
learning_outcomes: The pros and cons of working in virtual teams.
The importance of the right work systems, environment and communication to ensure teams are motivated and productive.
The manager's responsibility to provide the conditions for team success.

core.title: Managing Emotions Module
core.description: Driving both positive and negative behaviour, emotions help us to understand others and help others to understand us. It’s this level of understanding which enables you to effectively manage your emotions in the workplace. This module explores the different types of emotion, emotional triggers, and techniques for effectively managing your emotions in the workplace. In addition to a high quality video, this Module features expanded learning content blocks and a short quiz to check your understanding.

learning_outcomes: How emotions work and the impact they have on people
3 tips for understanding and managing your emotions in the workplace

core.title: Managing Change
core.description:
Change is an inevitable part of any organisation, and failure to embrace it will leave you behind. This course outlines the key stages of change and the practices you'll need to follow to manage and drive change within your team and organisation.

This lesson forms part of the Management Skills Award course.

metadata.summary: This course will help you effectively manage, drive and adapt to change in the workplace
learning_outcomes: The stages of effective change management
Factors to consider prior to implementing changes
The reasons why people resist change and how to overcome them
The principles and application of Lewin's Unfreeze-Change-Refreeze and Force-Field models
The principles and application of Kotter's eight step change process

core.title: Managing Absence
core.description:
Not everyone will be always fit and healthy all the time, so we can expect to have a certain number of people absent from work at any one time.
This only becomes an issue if the degree of absence is higher than average, or people are seen as taking advantage of the company’s absence policies. This session identifies what can be done to effectively manage absence and understand the reasons for it.
Once the session is completed, you will be able to Identify the way you need to deal with absence at work, recognise the people who you may need to be more sympathetic or empathetic towards and analyse the culture you wish to maintain when leading a team, so absence doesn’t become an issue.

learning_outcomes: Identify the way you need to deal with absence at work
Recognise the people who you may need to be more sympathetic or empathetic towards
Analyse the culture you wish to maintain when leading a team, so absence doesn’t become an issue.

core.title: Management versus Leadership
core.description:
To be a great manager you must also understand what it takes to be a great leader. This course will break down some of the key characteristics of leaders and managers which you can put them into practice to become more effective and valuable.

This lesson forms part of the Management Skills Award course.

metadata.summary: Increase your value as a leader with this breakdown of the vital skills you'll need to develop
learning_outcomes: The difference between the roles and responsibilities of managers and leaders

core.title: Making your new management position successful - Part B
core.description:
Your initial contacts will determine how successful you will be in your new role. This is something that has to be organized and structured properly helping you clarify the new rules of engagement.

This course will cover:

  • Your first meeting as a manager.
  • Making contact with your coworkers.
  • Your first decisions.

Target Audience

Prerequisites

It is recommended that you first work through Part A of this course.

PMI accreditation: earn 0.5 PDU points from PMI.

metadata.summary: Learn to resolve difficult situations and tackle complex management issues.

core.title: Making your new management position successful - Part A
core.description:
When a new manager takes over he/she must face real changes in the situation. Very often an employee is promoted to a managerial position on the basis of his or her recognized expertise. But managerial expertise is different. Managers have to learn to delegate. They also have to learn to motivate co-workers. This is one of the main lessons any new manager has to learn.

This course will cover:

  • How things will change when you become a manager.
  • Preparing for your new appointment with your boss.

Target Audience

Anyone who is taking up their first management posting.

Prerequisites

There are no prerequisites, but it is recommended that you also complete Part B of this course.

Accreditation

PMI accreditation: earn 0.5 PDU points from PMI.

learning_outcomes: What changes when you become a manager
The demands of a management posting and your medium-term priorities
How to prepare for your new appointment with your boss

core.title: Making Better Decisions Using Game Theory
core.description: Choosing the right location for your point of sale, making the best decisions as a group, defining your competitive strategy… all these situations can be controlled better using game theory. And as luck would have it, this course offers the chance to discover the origins and applications of this theory, to see things more clearly. But be prepared for a number of surprises: you’ll see the most trivial of your everyday decisions quite differently at the end of this course!

tags: Discover the origins of game theory

core.title: Make Time for You
core.description:
Welcome to Audio Learning from Assemble You.

If you’ve been feeling stressed out, anxious, or overwhelmed lately, you’re not alone. Today’s fast-paced, high-demand world requires us to manage so much and all at once. But, with a little tweak to your daily routine, you can more easily deal with what’s being thrown at you. You can calm down, slow down, and de-stress by making more time for yourself.

That’s right, make time for yourself. Sounds simple, but how do we actually take a step back from our busy lives and practice self-care?

In this track, we look at how to make time for yourself regardless of the pressure you are under.

metadata.summary: In this audio course from Assemble You, we look at ways to make time for yourself.
learning_outcomes: Learn how saying no can open up time for important self-care
Learn meditating even for just a few minutes a day can have great benefits
Learn how physical activity enables positive mood
Learn how a good sleep pattern contributes to a calm mind

core.title: Leading, not Managing People
core.description:
"Failing organizations are usually over-managed and under-led."

-Warren G. Bennis

Leaders, who spend more time managing their employees than leading them are less likely to achieve the top performance they seek because they focus on controlling employees and their tasks to accomplish a goal.

core.title: Leading and Managing Effective Virtual Teams
core.description:
Organizations are changing, and so are our offices. The new age millennials are shifting toward the virtual world. More and more organizations use virtual teams to meet corporate goals. This has created the need to determine how best to manage and lead these virtual groups. Traditional methods of managing on-site groups don’t work with remote workers, because virtual teams are most often composed of workers who are spread over a varied geographic and cultural expanse and communicate, for the most part, electronically. Future Workforce Report states that 63 percent of companies utilize virtual workers, but only 57 percent have standards in place to manage the process. In this lesson, you will learn to effectively guide teams that they rarely see face-to-face.


Accreditation

0.25 hours, Continuing Education Units (CEU) from the Society for Human Resource Management (SHRM)

0.25 hours, Continuing Education Units (CEU) from the HR Certificate Institute (HRCI)

metadata.summary: Learn how to effectively establish requirements and build mutual trust with your virtual team.

metadata.summary: How do you adjust your leadership style to adapt to this new virtual working world?
learning_outcomes: The differences between virtual and face to face leadership
What skills and behaviours are needed to be a great virtual team leader and how to develop them

core.title: Leading Innovation Teams
core.description:
Innovation converts an idea into a revenue-generating goods or service. Innovation is about bringing change in the existing ideas and products for betterment. Organizations require a change in thinking, culture, processes, and behaviors to promote innovation. Businesses that innovate have better productivity and performance. Innovation helps organizations respond to customer needs and exceed their service expectations. It makes the organizations aware of the existing opportunities and foresees the upcoming trends. In this track, you will learn about the different methods that will help you lead innovation in your organization.

 

Accreditation

0.25 hours, Continuing Education Units (CEU) from the Society for Human Resource Management (SHRM)

0.25 hours, Continuing Education Units (CEU) from the HR Certificate Institute (HRCI)

metadata.summary: Learn how to describe the four-step process of leading innovation sessions.
learning_outcomes: Describe an ideal change leader and team members
Explain the techniques of exercising innovation
Describe the four-step process of leading innovation sessions

core.title: Leading Generationally Diverse Teams
core.description:
The workforce in most of the organizations has a mix of four generations. Individuals from the Baby Boom era are moving closer to retirement, while a new generation of workers, Generation Z, are entering the business world. Different cultural events and forces have so distinctly molded the Baby Boomers, Generation X, Millennials, and Generation Z that their approaches to work vary greatly. In this lesson, you will learn that strategic leaders seize the opportunity to leverage the wisdom and experience of the oldest generation and the entrepreneurial, technological, and ideological strengths of the younger generations to prepare their organizations for the future.


Accreditation

0.25 hours, Continuing Education Units (CEU) from the Society for Human Resource Management (SHRM)

0.25 hours, Continuing Education Units (CEU) from the HR Certificate Institute (HRCI)

metadata.summary: Learn how to identify the similarities of all generations and learn to lead a generationally diverse team.
learning_outcomes: Identify the similarities of all generations
Learn to lead the generationally diverse team
Build the bridge between these generations

core.title: Leading Effective Teams
core.description:
All teams need coaches. That’s how they get better. Your role as the leader of a high-performing team is to provide the training, resources, coaching, and support they need—as individuals and as a team—so that they can grow in their abilities, and perform as efficiently and dynamically as possible. Because of today’s constantly evolving business environment, every individual, regardless of position or experience, needs ongoing training and coaching. Knowing which tools, training opportunities, and coaching methods work for each individual is critical. Research by Accenture found that 31% of employees left their jobs because they don’t like their boss; another 31% cited lack of empowerment as their reason for leaving. This lesson will help you build robust coaching connections and a toolkit that will help you develop your team’s skills, coach them to personal and professional success, and build a culture of growth and continuous improvement.

 

Accreditation

0.25 hours, Continuing Education Units (CEU) from the Society for Human Resource Management (SHRM)

0.25 hours, Continuing Education Units (CEU) from the HR Certificate Institute (HRCI)

metadata.summary: Define the training needs for your team.
learning_outcomes: Define the training needs for your team
Provide coaching to your team
Create growth opportunities for your team

core.title: Leading Dynamic Teams
core.description:
By definition, dynamic teams are composed of self-directed, goal-focused individuals, each with specific expertise and skills, who work together to create innovative solutions that consistently result in superior outcomes. But truly dynamic teams don’t just happen. They are the result of purposeful selection, a motivating vision, and strong leadership. In this course, you will learn how to identify potential team members, how much supervision and oversight to provide, and how best to motivate your people.


Accreditation

0.25 hours, Continuing Education Units (CEU) from the HR Certificate Institute (HRCI)

0.25 hours, Continuing Education Units (CEU) from the Society for Human Resource Management (SHRM)
